name: Wonga Pigeon
description: It has a robust build, gray-blue back, and creamy forehead. The underbelly is white with dark spots and stripes. Legs are fleshy red. Males and females are indistinguishable.
spread_note: Eastern Australia, from central Queensland to eastern Victoria
food_note: Fallen fruits and seeds, to a lesser extent invertebrates
image_alt: Wonga pigeon, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
attractions: It forages on the ground, moving along paths worn through the undergrowth. It emits a monotonous cooing audible up to 2 km away.
breeding: We have kept them in Prague since 2010.
